title: How your muscular system works - Emma Bryce

multiple-choice.question: What is the muscular system made up of?

options.label: C

options.label: D

options.text: To generate stabilizing forces, allowing us to grip and lean.

options.label: D

options.label: D

options.label: B
options.text: Fast-twitch fibers react quickly and use energy quickly, while slow-twitch fibers react slowly and use energy slowly.

options.label: C
options.text: Fast-twitch fibers are endurance cells, while slow-twitch fibers are quick-reacting cells.

options.label: D

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: To control the temperature of the body.

options.label: D
options.text: To control the blood flow to the muscles.

title: A brief history of banned numbers - Alessandra King

options.label: C

options.text: He was drowned as punishment from the gods.

options.label: D
options.text: Because they were less used in trade.

options.label: C

options.label: C

title: Are you a body with a mind or a mind with a body? - Maryam Alimardani

multiple-choice.question: What is the "rubber hand illusion"?

options.text: A sense that we don't have.

options.text: A sense that is not explicitly mentioned.

options.label: D

title: How do executive orders work? - Christina Greer

multiple-choice.question: What is an executive order, according to the transcript?

options.label: C
options.text: A tool available to the executive branch, issued without consultation or permission from Congress.

options.label: D
options.text: A bill proposed by a member of Congress.

multiple-choice.question: How does an executive order become a law?

options.label: B
options.text: It is signed by the president.

options.label: C
options.text: It is issued without consultation or permission from Congress, but enforced like a law.

options.label: D
options.text: It is vetoed by the president.

multiple-choice.question: What is the extent of the power of an executive order?

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: It can carry the weight of a law, but is subject to judicial review.

options.label: C
options.text: It can only be used to expand the power of agencies in the federal government.

options.label: D
options.text: It can only be used to clarify and implement a policy.

options.label: B
options.text: To establish requirements for nondiscriminatory practices in hiring and employment.

options.label: C
options.text: To target predominantly Japanese-Americans, as well as German-Americans and Italian-Americans, in certain regions across the country.

options.label: D
options.text: To establish the Works Progress Administration.

multiple-choice.question: How many executive orders did FDR issue?

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: The Constitution is somewhat ambiguous on the extent of the president's power to issue executive orders.

options.label: C

options.label: D
options.text: The Constitution requires the president to obtain permission from Congress before issuing executive orders.

multiple-choice.question: What is one way that Congress can counteract an executive order?

options.text: By passing a new law that supersedes the executive order.

options.label: B
options.text: By issuing a joint resolution that rejects the executive order.

options.label: C
options.text: By passing a bill that repeals the executive order.

options.label: D
options.text: By halting the executive order through judicial review.

multiple-choice.question: What is the effect of an executive order once the president who issued it leaves office?

options.label: A
options.text: The executive order remains in effect.

options.label: B
options.text: The executive order is automatically repealed.

options.label: C
options.text: The executive order can be repealed by the new president.

options.label: D
options.text: The executive order can be amended by the new president.

options.label: D
options.text: The transcript does not provide this information.

multiple-choice.question: What is one example of a positive and inclusive use of an executive order?

options.label: B
options.text: Harry Truman's executive order desegregating the armed forces.

options.label: C

options.text: To make the time range look shorter.

options.label: D
options.text: To make the time range look longer.

multiple-choice.question: What is the name of the technique used to hide important changes in data by picking specific data points?

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: Because it shows the maximum temperature variation each year.

options.label: C
options.text: Because it shows the minimum temperature variation each year.

options.label: D
options.text: Because it shows the insignificant temperature variation each year.

options.label: A

options.label: B

title: What causes kidney stones? - Arash Shadman

multiple-choice.question: What is the biggest kidney stone on record known to have weighed?
What is a kidney stone?

options.label: C
options.text: A hard mass of crystals that can form in the kidneys, ureters, bladder, or urethra

multiple-choice.question: What is the most common type of crystal to form a kidney stone?
What can happen if a kidney stones move through the kidney and into the ureter?

options.label: A
options.text: They can cause a slight burning sensation while urinating

options.label: B
options.text: They can cause nerve endings to transmit excruciating pain signals through the nervous system

options.label: C
options.text: They can cause blood to flow into the urine

multiple-choice.question: What is one option for treating medium-sized kidney stones up to about 10 millimeters?

options.label: C
options.text: Using high-intensity pulses of focused ultrasonic energy to pulverize the stone

multiple-choice.question: What can happen if a kidney stone blocks the flow of urine?

options.label: B
options.text: It can damage the kidneys themselves

options.label: C
options.text: It can cause a slight burning sensation while urinating

multiple-choice.question: What is one option for treating kidney stones that are too big to be pulverized with soundwaves?

options.label: C
options.text: Placing a rigid tube called a stent in the ureter to expand it

multiple-choice.question: What can help prevent kidney stones from forming?

options.label: C

title: How to squeeze electricity out of crystals - Ashwini Bharathula

multiple-choice.question: What is piezoelectricity?

options.label: A
options.text: The ability of a material to conduct electricity.

options.label: B
options.text: The ability of a material to change shape when subjected to electricity.

options.label: C
options.text: The ability of a material to turn mechanical stress into electricity and vice versa.

options.label: D
options.text: The ability of a material to insulate electricity.

multiple-choice.question: Who discovered the phenomenon of piezoelectricity?

options.label: A
options.text: Pierre Curie and his brother Jacques in 1800.

options.label: B
options.text: Pierre Curie and his brother Jacques in 1880.

multiple-choice.question: What is a unit cell in the context of piezoelectric materials?

options.label: A
options.text: A group of atoms or ions arranged in a three-dimensional pattern.

options.label: B
options.text: A single atom or ion that makes up a piezoelectric material.

options.label: C
options.text: A collection of piezoelectric materials arranged together.

options.label: D
options.text: A type of electrical charge that occurs in piezoelectric materials.

multiple-choice.question: What makes a material a candidate for piezoelectricity?

options.label: A
options.text: The presence of a center of symmetry in its atomic structure.

options.label: B
options.text: The absence of a center of symmetry in its atomic structure.

options.label: C
options.text: The presence of a specific type of electrical charge.

options.label: D
options.text: The absence of any electrical charge.

multiple-choice.question: What is the result of compressing a piezoelectric material along a certain direction?
What is the result of stretching a piezoelectric material instead of compressing it?
What is the difference between piezoelectric quartz crystals and other materials?

options.label: A
options.text: Piezoelectric quartz crystals have a center of symmetry in their atomic structure.

options.label: B
options.text: Piezoelectric quartz crystals do not have a center of symmetry in their atomic structure.

options.label: C
options.text: Piezoelectric quartz crystals are more conductive than other materials.

options.label: D
options.text: Piezoelectric quartz crystals are less conductive than other materials.

multiple-choice.question: What is the application of piezoelectricity in sonar instruments?

options.label: A
options.text: To detect objects underwater using sound waves.

options.label: B
options.text: To communicate with objects underwater using sound waves.

options.label: C
options.text: To measure the depth of water using sound waves.

options.label: D
options.text: To navigate underwater using sound waves.

multiple-choice.question: What is the result of clapping hands on a piezoelectric device?
What is the potential application of piezoelectricity in the future?

options.label: A
options.text: To power electronic devices using mechanical energy.

options.label: B
options.text: To generate electricity using solar energy.

title: How do nuclear power plants work? - M. V. Ramana and Sajan Saini

multiple-choice.question: What was the first engineering marvel that scientists created to crack open the nucleus at the center of the uranium atom and turn nuclear mass into energy?

options.label: B
options.text: It has a high number of neutrons

options.label: C
options.text: It has a total of 238 protons and neutrons, but roughly one in every 140 lacks three neutrons

options.label: D
options.text: It has a low number of protons

multiple-choice.question: What is the process called when a uranium nucleus splits into two or more smaller nuclei, releasing energy in the process?

options.label: B
options.text: To decrease the rate of fission

options.label: C
options.text: To capture excess neutrons and keep their number in check

options.label: C

options.label: D
options.text: It leads to a stable rate of fission

options.label: A
options.text: To increase the rate of fission

options.label: B
options.text: To decrease the rate of fission

options.label: D

multiple-choice.question: What is the main danger of a nuclear meltdown?

options.label: C
options.text: The release of radioactive material into the environment

options.label: D
options.text: The release of heat from the fission reaction

multiple-choice.question: What is the main challenge for a nuclear reactor after the fuel is used up?

options.label: B
